CSSPercentage.summary: The <percentage> CSS data type represents a percentage value. It is often used to define a size as relative to an element's parent object. Numerous properties can use percentages, such as width, height, margin, padding, and font-size.

blockquote.para: Note: Only calculated values can be inherited. Thus, even if a percentage value is used on the parent property, a real value (such as a width in pixels for a {{CSSxRef("<length>")}} value) will be accessible on the inherited property, not the percentage value.
